newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia stocks bounce higher at end, ignore Dow.
newsitem.headline: Australia stocks bounce higher at end, ignore Dow.

text.p: The Australian share market closed higher on Thursday after recently-weak resource giants BHP and CRA rebounded on bargain hunting in late trading.
The All Ordinaries index closed 12 points higher at 2247.1, ignoring a fall on Wall Street.
Brokers said BHP and CRA had been oversold on concerns over metal prices and now represented good value, particularly with some confidence returning to metal markets overnight.

"The market was looking fairly ordinary earlier on, but BHP and CRA started to come back a bit in the afternoon after people thought they had been sold down too far," said Matthew Bloom a trader at stockbrokers James Capel.
Bloom said steady gains in bond prices helped lift bank and other yield-sensitive stocks.
He said News Corp's annoucement that a budgeted strong profit rise in 1996/97 was attainable was also a plus for a market which had lacked good news lately.
The focus of the market on Friday will be BHP's first quarter results.
"The market has got such a range on BHP that it's difficult to know which way it's going to go," Bloom said.
September share price index futures also finished with a 12 point gain to 2246 but remained at a slight discount to the underlying index.
